channel.title: iOS frustrations
channel.description:
I'm about to rant, so if yer not in the mood just bypass this.
How the actual f*ck do you guys manage to not want to just snap your device in half? I literally spent 30 minutes trying to copy a wave file out of blocs wave, to the clipboard, to garageband and it keeps pasting a loop I copied yesterday. WHAT THE :face_with_symbols_over_mouth:
I know I could have exported to audio share, or even save to Files and copy out of there, but it's bull. These weird "workflow" things drive me absolutely nuts, it makes me want to totally pack it in for mobile production.
Does anyone commiserate? Misery loves company :drooling_face:

item.title: iOS frustrations
item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description:
Yeah, Files app does seem to be the most consistent. It probably doesn’t help that I’m trying to use the method from like 2011…

Read full topic

How the actual f*ck do you guys manage to not want to just snap your device in half? I literally spent 30 minutes trying to copy a wave file out of blocs wave, to the clipboard, to garageband and it keeps pasting a loop I copied yesterday. WHAT THE

item.title: iOS frustrations
item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description:
Don’t get me wrong, I’m not slagging FL it’s just fine, it’s not bad at all. I just can’t get on with the UI anymore and the way they present stuff like the mixer, especially the mixer. It just drives me bonkers. It’s totally personal taste. Lord knows I’ve written a TON of music on FL and it’s def not a bad program. I just drank from the Propellerhead juice and it spoiled everything lol

Read full topic

xD no worries x3

I only use fl since I was recommended it, I don’t have Apple for logic and I can’t afford ableton

item.title: iOS frustrations
item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description:
Man if I’m gonna use a computer I might as well just go back to using Reason. Trying to avoid using a computer lol.

I think the problem is I want the workflow ease of use in a mobile form factor, like tablet / phone mobile, and it’s just not possible. Ah well. I feel better now I was just super chuffed having spent basically my whole lunch trying to move 1 f*ckin sample. YIIIIIKES

Read full topic

item.description:
reeeeee

use a computer

Read full topic

item.title: iOS frustrations
item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description:
This is how I side chain in FL-

  1. Place kick sample
  2. Place lead
  3. Close FL
  4. Control panel > Programs and Features
  5. Uninstall

I’m sorry lol I couldn’t resist. I really am super biased and I will admit it.

All kidding aside, of the ways I’ve seen, this way does seem to require the least amount of fenagling. Once you get it perfect I think you can save your mixer channels as a template, or even just the whole project as a template.

Read full topic

item.description:
So this is the best way to do it? D:

item.title: iOS frustrations
item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description:
Yeah I hear ya. It really is so annoying on this platform. It takes three times longer to do anything, so frustrating. And that’s WHEN it works properly. I deleted all the projects but I guarantee you the next time I try to copy paste it’s still gonna paste that same drum loop I copied to pasteboard f*cking three days ago.

This is the stuff that just drives me TOTALLY INSANE

Read full topic

item.title: iOS frustrations
item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description:
Lol I hate to tell you but, this way is wayyyy more direct than using the envelope controller. Especially since you still need to do all the weird channel juggling.

I saw all those green lines at the bottom of the mixer and it made me ill for a sec. ugh ugh, I just don’t get it… obviously it’s just my opinion, not objective at all.

Read full topic

item.title: iOS frustrations
item.dc:creator: TheRealJFalc
item.description:
I can’t be sure since I’m not at my desktop atm xD i’m not even sure of it myself but all I know is that trying to use different fruity limiters for kick ducking was causing the kick to distort when it probably shouldn’t have.

Read full topic

item.title: iOS frustrations
item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description:
How are you doing it? You can use the envelope controller I think, that’s the only way I know how at least. You pick a source channel (where the kick lives) and have that automate the volume knob for your synth channel.

If you’re already doing that than my apologies, I seriously cannot stand FL anymore. Just such weirdness like this drives me crazy. Every time I crack it open I just slump down in my chair and sigh lol…

Read full topic

item.title: iOS frustrations

item.description:
It’s because ducking is done through a plug-in and even then it’s stupid. Idfk xD

item.description:
I’m frustrated too cause lately, everything I’m writing is 25-50% sample loops and it’s really such a chore to do this in Auxy. I’m like wtf am I doing this to myself for lol…

Read full topic

item.title: iOS frustrations
item.dc:creator: iammane
item.description:
The mixer in FL doesn’t really make sense to me. As long as I’ve been using it, it just seems weird. When I first tried out Reason it made SO much more sense, and actually helped clarify insert vs send effects for me. Ducking in Reason would be very simple because you could split kick signal (duplicate it), send one to side chain and one to mixer out.

Sometimes it’s just so effin frustrating on iOS, apps just crashing, Copy and paste just… not, apparently lol. Barf.

Read full topic

item.title: iOS frustrations
item.dc:creator: Polar
item.description:
iOS makes me so mad lol, if you don’t have the new phone, then you are basically screwed with a slow device until you spend $1000. Tbh I would be using an android or a pixel if it wasn’t for Auxy

Read full topic

item.title: iOS frustrations
item.dc:creator: TheRealJFalc
item.description:
iammane:

These weird “workflow” things drive me absolutely nuts

I completely agree. I’ve been learning fl studio recently. Ducking sound is the absolute worst thing if you’re ducking to the kick in any other time than 4/4 (or any regular kick beat for that matter). Trying to set different types of ducker on different channels causes the kick to overcompress and distort. Muting a kick just to duck it doesn’t actually do anything either which makes no sense. It’s the literal worst thing. I am so thankful for auxy making this not an issue. Seriously it’s ridiculous.

I would love to just copy a wav file into other apps but apple doesn’t seem to understand that features that should make sense aren’t a priority compared to their outright fetish of making their phones thinner at whatever cost to structural integrity that may occur.

spoiler

Read full topic

item.title: iOS frustrations
item.dc:creator: Db909
item.description:
It’s frustrating for sure. Which is why I typically make music in one app at a time and don’t really mix apps together unless I’m sampling sounds from one app to be composed in another. Even when all the copy/paste, etc stuff works, it still takes up a lot of time if you’re doing frequently. So I typically do all of that kind of crap in one session where it’s just all about organization, moving things, etc

Read full topic
